data.title: The editor has crashed
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When I switch desktops on my Linux box (Gentoo, Awesome WM without other graphic environments) After one or two switches Atom crashesh displaying error "The Editor has crashed ...". After reloading the window it works unless I switch the desktops again.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. launch atom
2. Switch to other desktop and switch back
3. Repeat the step 2. several times fast enough (I noticed that when I'm switching desktop every 15-20 seconds, the issue appears but not so often. If I switch it in 1-5 seconds it appears almost always).
4. The error appears. Restart Atom -> point 1

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

The app should not crash.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The app Crashes.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.3
Electron: 0.36.12
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 5.10.1
python 3.4.3
git 2.7.3

Os: Gentoo linux (rolling release, no version)

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: -W is an invalid option for pwd
data.body:
I'm running Atom 1.8.0 beta 3 on Windows 7. It works, but when I try to launch it using the `atom` shell command, I get this failure:

```
{ ~ }  » atom                                                                                   ~
/cygdrive/c/Users/Linda/AppData/Local/atom/bin/../app-1.8.0-beta3/resources/cli/atom.sh: line 3: pwd: -W: invalid option
pwd: usage: pwd [-LP]
Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601]
Copyright (c) 2009 Microsoft Corporation.  All rights reserved.
```

I'm using [babun](http://babun.github.io/) as my shell, which may be part of the problem. I believe the failing line of code is [resources/win/atom.sh on line 3](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/resources/win/atom.sh#L3). It doesn't look like `-W` is a standard flag for the `pwd` command.

Can anyone else reproduce this issue?

data.title: Atom 1.7.3 asciidoc-preview rendering broken
data.body:
### Description

Atom 1.7.3: Previewing asciidoc works as expected. The preview no longer renders automatically though. Specifically, one cannot see an automatic update of new information render in the preview window until they close the preview window and reopen it.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Write anything to an .adoc file
2. Preview with asciidoc-preview using the Ctrl + Shift + A (Cmd + Shift + A on Mac)
3. Preview will render as normal
4. Edit the information in the .adoc file
5. The preview pane will not reflect the updated information.

**Expected behavior:** Preview pane should live update the information. This is a working feature in Atom version 1.7.2

**Actual behavior:** Preview pane needed to be closed and reopened to reflect edits to the information.
### Versions

Atom version: 1.7.3
APM version: 1.9.2
Tested on Mac OS X 10.11.4
### Note

This is not a package issue because the asciidoc-preview hasn't received any updates since 2015-08-12.

For example, encoding closed curly quotes returns `’`. Preferably, `’` is the desired result.

Is `’` the preferred HTML5 method? Maybe I'm just too old?

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined
data.body:
This issue started to appear on master today (as far as I can tell), and was not occuring before so I guess it was introduced by a regression recently.
1. With pigments installed, open a big CSS/Less/Sass file (100+ lines)
2. Select a bug portion of text at the begin of the file (in my case it was around 20 lines, I found that below 5-6 lines the error started to occur randomly)
3. Try to cut/delete the selected code.

@as-cii Maybe it's me that is not doing things correctly given the recent change in the API, but since it was working before I think something must have changed in the TextEditorComponent/TxtEditorPresenter stuff.

**Atom Version**: 1.9.0-dev-e1a200a

data.title: Atom 1.7.3 crashes on startup (segmentation fault) on Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
Atom is suddenly crashing on startup. I did not recently add any packages, but I did recently attempt to open an 81K xml file which caused the initial crash. I can open atom in safe mode, but **cannot disable most of my packages**. i've also tried disabling packages via apm and it hasn't seemed to do anything. this is the only error message i've seen;

data.title: Atom 1.7.3 crash on Mac OS X 10.10.5 when opening 47MB JSON file

Opening a json file crashes Atom.  Crashes in safe mode and with all packages disabled and .atom temporarily re-named.

1. Open a large json file (mine is 43MB), here is an example:

data.title: Sanitize Config String Before Writing to config.cson
data.body:
- Go to a package with at least one config field of type string. (for example, Ignored Name field in fuzzy-finder package)
- Try typing something like `#{ a }` to the string field
- Atom will display an error message saying that config.cson cannot be loaded. And configuration will not work anymore unless you go to the config.cson file and delete the error line manually.

This probably is because config.cson is treated as a regular coffee script file and `"#{ a }"` is treated as a coffee script string interpolation which translated to `"..." + a + "..."` in javascript. Since `a` is not presented in the scope, it causes the error.
I think sanitizing the string before writing to config.cson should make this problem go away.

data.title: Atom helper occupies high CPU resource
data.body: When I use atom on mac(OS X 10.11.4), atom is very dull behavior, so I check Activity monitor, and I discovered that atom helper occupies high CPU resource. Please fix this symptom.

data.title: The atom terminal command does not open a new window
data.body:
The terminal commands `atom` or `atom --wait` do not open a new Atom window as expected when there is at least one already opened Atom window. When no windows exists, the command works and opens a new window. This makes Atom almost useless as git editor.

I see this behaviour both in atom-1.8.0-beta3 and 1.7.3. I'm running OSX 10.11.5. My shell is fish.

data.title: atom terminal command only works when app is not running
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

The `atom` terminal command works only when atom is not currently running. When the app is running, subsequent attempts to use the `atom` command do not work.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Ensure installation of shell commands from the atom menu.
2. Quit Atom. 
3. Open Terminal
4. execute `atom my_file.txt` (works!)
5. execute `atom my_other_file.txt` (doesn't work :-/)

**Expected behavior:** The `atom` command should open files/folders upon subsequent attempts.

**Actual behavior:** Subsequent attempts do quickly flash the Mac menu bar's active application from **Terminal** to **Atom**, but the file never opens.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

Atom    : 1.7.3
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.4

Mac OS El Capitan - version 10.11.4

I recently installed xcode, which could perhaps be the cause of the error.

data.title: Atom1.7.3 crashes every few minutes on Win10 x64
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Windows 10 x64, Atom v1.7.3 (installed with the Windows installer)

Atom is crashing every 3-5 Minutes or so without any error message. The dev console doesn't show any information either.

Happens when editing a local file, while typing. 

Maybe this is related? #11590 talks about this happening while having lots of uncommited files. In my case just one is enough. Using atom in safe mode and editing a file that is not under version control works fine.

[operation_log.txt](https://gist.github.com/andrinheusser/7c753cf2552dc3c75f7dda96647d06f3)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Use Atom v1.7.2 for a while on Windows 10 x64.
2. Editor crashes almost every hour when I'm regularly typing in the editor.

Expected behavior: Should not crash that often.

Actual behavior: Crashes frequently.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.3
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.3
git
visual studio

Win 10 x64
Intel i5-2500 @ 3.3 GHz
16 GB Ram

data.title: Lazy evaluation of search results may fail if the app window gets resized
data.body:
### Description

Lazy evaluation of search results gets triggered on scroll, that's way the initial showed results are a bit more than what can be displayed without scrolling. The problem is that I can search for something with a lot of results, than resize the app window to be double in size and now all the initial results fit comfortably within the panel, and since I cannot scroll them I can't see the other results.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Resize Atom's window to be small enough 
2. Search for something with a lot of results
3. Double Atom's window size, or increase it enough
4. Try view all the results and fail 

**Expected behavior:** I guess a dirty and easy fix would be to recompute the initial results when a resize event happen (hopefully using debouncing) if not all of them are displayed.

**Actual behavior:** Only a fraction of the results are visible, in a now unscrollable list.
### Versions

1.8.0-beta3
